description: This course explores the interplay of visual image, written text, and material object in a variety of genres including illustrated novels, comics, fine press books, and artists books. Through writing, research, and book making, students engage with social, political, and aesthetic issues related to books and book production at various historical moments. This course encourages creative effort and welcomes all levels of art experience.
name: Top: Book, Text, Art

revisions.description: In addition to the traditional practices of literary study, cross-disciplinary courses include materials from at least one other academic discipline, requiring students to compare and combine disciplinary perspectives in literary analysis. Examples of courses taught under this heading might include Literature and Politics; Religion and the Novel; Philosophical Approaches to Literature. May be repeated if topic is different. Click on course title in the class and lab for more information about the course for that term. Prerequisite: FYW.

title: Topics in Cross-Disciplinary Literary Study
